text: {| |} The Aeronca 12AC Chum was a 2-seat cabin monoplane designed and produced by Aeronca in the United States in 1946. The design was a licence-built version of the ERCO Ercoupe. Aeronca built two examples, the first with the standard twin-tail and a second with a single tail, modified landing gear and all-metal wings. ==Specifications (Chum) == ==References== Category:1940s United States civil utility aircraft Category:Low-wing aircraft Category:Single-engined tractor aircraft
title: Aeronca 12 Chum
